criteria.description: Word counter handles hyphenated words, contractions, and emoji consistently; tests cover edge cases.
criteria.justification: rollout.py counts words using a whitespace regex (\S+), which treats hyphenated words, contractions, and emoji as single tokens consistently; however, there are no explicit tests or documented edge-case handling.

criteria.description: Reward tiers clearly differentiate exact count vs off-by-one vs larger misses, with documented values.
criteria.justification: Reward uses a continuous function (1 - diff/target) without discrete tiers or documentation distinguishing exact, off-by-one, and larger errors.

criteria.description: Theme adherence check (keyword match or embedding similarity) influences reward or metadata.
criteria.justification: No theme adherence evaluation is performed; theme is only included in prompt/metadata and does not affect reward or logged metrics.

criteria.description: Environment logs `word_count`, `count_difference`, and `theme_match` for every rollout.
criteria.justification: Actual word count and difference are logged in trajectory.metrics, but there is no theme_match metric recorded.

criteria.description: Output sanitizer enforces plain text (no markup) and strips leading/trailing whitespace before scoring.
criteria.justification: Only a type check for string is performed; there is no explicit plain-text enforcement or whitespace stripping prior to scoring.

notes: Overall design is functional for basic word counting and smooth reward but lacks tiered rewards, theme adherence checks, explicit logging of theme_match, and output sanitization. No tests are present for edge cases.
